reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great fit in the drawer
reviews.reviewText: I love the way it fit in my drawers. I have an older house 35+ years old and my drawers in the kitchen or small not very deep and I was afraid it wouldn’t fit. But it fit great my knife fit in there really nice. I had them out with the block on the counter, but they get dusty and dirty and II love the way it fit in my drawers. I have a older house 35+ years old and my drawers in the kitchen or small not very deep and I was afraid it wouldn’t fit. But it fit great my knife fit in there really nice. I had them out with the block on the counter but they get dusty and dirty and I just wanted to put them away and it worked out really great for me. I’m very happy the way it is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great drawer knife holder
reviews.reviewText: I didn't want to leave my knives on the counter in the knife block so I ordered these. We have a lot of cutting knives and knives that we use with dinner. So, I ordered three. They fit well in a drawer next to each other and they held all of our knives. The only thing is if you have a knife that doesn't have a very thin handle you might not be able to place one knife per slot. I had to skip a couple of slots with some of my knives but I ordered enough that I still managed to fit all of them in the drawer. Really well priced and easy to use

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's a simple product that works as intended.
reviews.reviewText: My expectations were low as I awaited the arrival of this in-drawer knife block, since a few reviewers described it as flimsy and disappointing. It is a chunk of indestructible, weaponized oak? Absolutely not. But if the point is to remove the giant chunk of tree from a countertop to create usable space, this horizontal knife block is perfect. It's hollow plastic, so it doesn't add much weight to a utensil drawer. The slots are spaced to accommodate everything from tiny paring blades to giant, serrated bread knives. Small-handled knives can go in consecutive slots on the top row, while ones with substantial handles can be neatly stored on the bottom tier with a free slot or two between them. Prior to purchasing this, I laid all my knives flat on a silicone mat in the drawer, which was fine until I realized what a waste of valuable storage space that was. Will this knife block survive a nuclear holocaust? No. But it's far from flimsy! It's exactly the density it needs to be to do its very specific job. It stays in place nicely when I open and close the drawer and it freed up eight inches of drawer width and all but eliminated the risk of injury from reaching into a drawer full of loose knives. Call me impressed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Be mindful of the knife handle widths
reviews.reviewText: I really like this and it fits in my drawer well. However I did not factor in the width of my knife handles (Chicago cutlery are substantial and handles quite wide compared to others). As a result, the knives didn't fit as well as I had hoped. However, I realized that I have other knives that need storage so plan to buy a second unit as my drawer can accomodate another. The plus is not having wood blocks taking up counter space!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I ordered one so I could see how well it was made and to see how well it would fit in my drawer because I actually needed more than 1 and for the price of $10 I was pleasantly surprised how sturdy and how well it fit so ordered 2 more (I have alot of knives). For the price they are really nice I was kinda surprised and absolutely recommend these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love this! Perfect size for my drawer ,sturdy and nice

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I bought this knife organizer because it generally had good reviews and I added a few knives to me collection and needed a bit more space. Unfortunately, I didn't gain much in space and it doesn't look as nice as the bamboo knife organizer that I was using previously.The deception comes from the fact that the spaces that hold the knives are very close together. So a knife with a thick handle cannot be placed immediately next to another knife with a thick of medium handle. There isn't enough room between the slots and therefore, you end up losing space because you have to set knives farther apart.I am not pleased with the product and I failed to gain the additional space I needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Knife holder works great and keeps drawer organized. Wished there were no slip grips on bottom as it has a tendency to slid around.
This fits perfectly in my drawer alongside the same brand cutlery organizer. Holds many knives and easy to clean.
Ayuda a mantener ordenado el cajón de cubiertos o colocarlo en la encimera y se ve bien

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: I'm only sorry I didn't buy it sooner.
reviews.reviewText: I've considered getting one of these to free up the kitchen side so we don't have to have the knife block.. I can't mount knives to rental tiled kitchen. And this seemed logical. Fits with plenty of wiggle room; but doesn't wiggle or move. Easy to use. Not yet had to clean.. Had it a month or so and one of the best things I've bought. Plus looks so expensive I got called a 'posh bugger' - I'm so not posh lol 😂 love it. Get it. Don't question the price. Just get it and go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on August 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Eindelijk een fijne, ruime messenhouder voor in de keukenla. Geen geschuif, snijkant beschadigen of moeten zoeken naar het juiste mes.
